author: Tracey Torble
message:
Merge pull request #1745 from Sammak/patch-9

Add deep analysis section to agent optimization doc

ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: {
  "sha": "dbceb343df0aac8cdea3be55a5bab455794164de",
  "filename": "docs/identity/conditional-access/agent-optimization.md",
  "status": "modified",
  "additions": 1,
  "deletions": 0,
  "changes": 1,
  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/c52115408cc9d02faa9671674e90ecd93a47e3bc/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/c52115408cc9d02faa9671674e90ecd93a47e3bc/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization.md?ref=c52115408cc9d02faa9671674e90ecd93a47e3bc",
  "patch": "@@ -78,6 +78,7 @@ The policy suggestions identified by the agent include:\n - **Risky users**: The agent suggests a policy to require secure password change for high risk users. Requires Microsoft Entra ID P2 license.\n - **Risky sign-ins**: The agent suggests a policy to require multifactor authentication for high risk sign-ins. Requires Microsoft Entra ID P2 license.\n - **Policy consolidation**: The agent scans your policy and identifies overlapping settings. For example, if you have more than one policy that has the same grant controls, the agent suggests consolidating those policies into one.\n+- **Deep analysis**: The agent looks at policies that correspond to key scenarios to identify outlier policies that have more than a recommended number of exceptions (leading to unexpected gaps in coverage) or no exceptions (leading to possible lockout). \n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n > The agent doesn't make any changes to existing policies unless an administrator explicitly approves the suggestion."
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the documentation for agent optimisation in Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access. A new policy suggestion, "Deep analysis", has been added. This feature allows the agent to identify outlier policies that have an excessive number of exceptions or no exceptions at all, potentially leading to coverage gaps or user lockouts.

For example, if you have more than one policy that has the same grant controls, the agent suggests consolidating those policies into one.\n-- **Deep Analysis**: The agent looks at policies that correspond to key scenarios to identify outlier policies that have more than a recommended number of exceptions (leading to unexpected gaps in coverage) or no exceptions (leading to possible lockout). \n+- **Deep analysis**: The agent looks at policies that correspond to key scenarios to identify outlier policies that have more than a recommended number of exceptions (leading to unexpected gaps in coverage) or no exceptions (leading to possible lockout). \n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n > The agent doesn't make any changes to existing policies unless an administrator explicitly approves the suggestion."
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies the documentation for agent optimisation in Conditional Access. The change is a minor grammatical correction, changing "Deep Analysis" to "Deep analysis" in a list of policy suggestions. This refinement aims to improve the clarity and consistency of the documentation.

For example, if you have more than one policy that has the same grant controls, the agent suggests consolidating those policies into one.\n-- **Deep Analysis**: The agent looks at your policies corresponding to key scenarios to identifie outlier policies that have more than a recommended amount of exceptions (leading to unexpected gaps in coverage) or no exceptions (leading to possible lockout). \n+- **Deep Analysis**: The agent looks at policies that correspond to key scenarios to identify outlier policies that have more than a recommended number of exceptions (leading to unexpected gaps in coverage) or no exceptions (leading to possible lockout). \n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n > The agent doesn't make any changes to existing policies unless an administrator explicitly approves the suggestion."

ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies the documentation for agent optimisation in Conditional Access policies. The change refines the description of the "Deep Analysis" feature, clarifying that the agent identifies outlier policies based on the number of exceptions, aiming to prevent unexpected coverage gaps or potential lockouts.
